bug.short_desc: "Missing number, treated as zero." errors with texlive-koma-script
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
The version of the typearea LaTeX package (part of the texlive-koma-script Fedora package) in texlive 2016-17.20160520.fc25 is 3.20. However, 3.20 has a bug which makes the package unusable, as "Missing number, treated as zero." errors are produced unless pagesize=false is added to the document class. This is a known issue which has been fixed in version 3.21 of the typearea LaTeX package.
Essentially, the texlive-koma-script package needs to be upgraded to KOMA-Script 3.21, which is the latest version on CTAN, to fix a known bug.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): 2016-17.20160520.fc25
How reproducible:
Reproduction steps are available on komascript.de[1] (in German) and on the LaTeX Stack Exchange site.[2]
[1]: http://www.komascript.de/release3.20
[2]: https://tex.stackexchange.com/questions/313519/mactex-2016-compile-generates-errors
texlive-2016-22.20160520.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-871210a6e2

texlive-2016-22.20160520.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-871210a6e2
texlive-2016-22.20160520.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
